message1.txt: Starting the day with proper procedures will help keep you organized as you build your load and create customer invoices.

tasks.task1: Assist start of day process, if needed
tasks.task2: Verify the sales date on the screen. Call support at 1-855-218-1613
tasks.task3: Ensure all steps are completed before leaving the sales center
tasks.task4: Reinforce invoice is final once the sales center is departed

tasks.task1: Assist the in-store process from receiving to merchandising

message1.txt: Scan Based Trading (SBT) is a crucial part of route operation. A count of inventory should be taken in every SBT account each week. This count should be completed on the first day of service each week. You will learn more about SBT later in your Onboarding. This week complete inventories in all applicable accounts while demonstrating the process to the COACH.

tasks.task1: Assist pulling returns from the shelf and displays
tasks.task2: Assist completing an SBT inventory, including all backstock and displays (Monday only)

message1.txt: Proper merchandising to DSDE standards can greatly enhance your success. Quality merchandising is your 'Silent Seller' representing you and your brands when you are not in the store. Your COACH will discuss the DSDE merchandising standards with you and help you set both the shelf and any secondary displays to standard.

tasks.task1: Explain DSDE merchandising standards
tasks.task2: Set the customer's shelf to plan-o-gram (POG)
tasks.task3: Explain shelf merchandising including POS and price tags
tasks.task4: Explain secondary display DSDE merchandising standards (Variety over Power)

message1.txt: Building relationships with the decision makers in your customers will aid in being a successful business owner. It is important to have regular communication with decision makers, updating them on current status and gaining support for upcoming promotional events. Assist this week while your COACH has conversations with store decision makers.

tasks.task1: Sell in a secondary display using fact based selling
tasks.task2: Later in week, give results from display

tasks.task1: Assist with end of day procedures
tasks.task2: Assist finalizing and transferring returns
tasks.task4: Assist printing the daily settlement report

day15.final_message: Tomorrow will be a day with the COACH. Establish a start time and plan to meet them at the Sales Center.

day17.txt:
Day 17
Wednesday on Route/Classroom/Route Closing (Today's Focus: Merchandising, ION/SCO)

message1.txt: On a non-delivery day, it is important you visit your customers to work up and back stock while also pulling up the shelf and and displays. This also is an opportunity to discuss business with store decision makers.

tasks.task1: *Merchandise the shelf and displays at each customer
tasks.task2: Merchandise backstock from the backroom

message1.txt: Route Closing with OSL and Selling IBP (if applicable)

tasks.task1: Complete route closing with all parties present
Explain basic ION navigation and functions
tasks.task2: Explain making and adjusting orders at the product level in ION
tasks.task4: Explain order windows and product lead time
tasks.task5: Review promotional calendars and how to use them
tasks.task6: Explain SCO basics, how it works, and the importance
